description: Lenart Kova quietly gathers and verifies sensitive BCI directive logs and detainment records, deciding to expose the truth about forced disappearances linked to the BCI system.
A trusted group of independent citizen journalists receives a secure handoff from Lenart: archives and directive logs detailing BCI-driven disappearances and Council cover-ups.
Survivors, prompted by the document leak, share their stories at open gatherings. Intense public outrage sparks citywide vigils and collective demands for truth and accountability.
Journalists release confirmed Council documents revealing the scale of secret detainments. Senior Council members resign amid mass protest and calls for systemic reform.
Nightly candlelit vigils and public forums continue, with growing demands for amnesty and independent investigations. The Council is pressured to open all records and address victims' rights.
